activities.loc: Branch I, Courthouse Annex, Second Floor

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryker L. Shampo

records.addlTxt:
10:15 AM  Defendant Ryker L. Shampo appeared by Zoom video from Oshkosh Correctional, in custody.  Attorney Richard S Zoellner in court for Ryker L. Shampo.  Prosecuting attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case
Atty Zoellner is being heard regarding Motion to Withdraw
Def is being heard
Court is being heard regarding withdrawal
ADA is being heard regarding victims
Def is being heard 
Court grants withdrawal of Atty Zoellner
Court cancels Jury Trial and PTC
Atty Zoellner to contact Public Defenders office to get new attorney appointed to the case
10:23 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:15 PM Defendant Ryker L. Shampo in court, in custody.  Attorney Richard S Zoellner in court for Ryker L. Shampo.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Zoellner heard - case is not yet resolved.
Requests a jury trial be scheduled.
Parties agree to a 2-day trial.
Court schedules with parties.
Proposed jury instructions, verdicts, and motions to be submitted to the court by close of business on October 24, 2022.
1:20 PM
Jury trial scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Restitution Summary and Victim Impact Statement CA.

Waives reading

Requests STC

records.addlTxt:
09:04 AM Defendant Ryker L. Shampo in court, in custody.  Kathryn E Heineck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ryker L. Shampo appeared by video means.
Court calls case.
Atty Schraven is present and is heard.
Deft qualifies, but there is a conflict for their office.
Atty Zoellner is present and is heard.
Will represent, pending conflict check.
DA provides copy of complaint.
Court schedules.
ADA heard.
Court approves deft to appear by ZOOM, if he is sent to prison.
9:06 AM
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

03:39 PM Defendant Ryker L. Shampo in court, in custody.  Kathryn E Heineck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ryker L. Shampo appeared by video means.
Court calls case.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
Court reviews charges and maximum penalties.
ADA heard on bond recommendations.
Deft heard.
Court imposes $10,000 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid Rx, no contact by any means with C.A., no contact with anyone at the address on Cleveland Ave where the incident happened. 
Deft to contact the Public Defenders office today.
Court schedules with parties.
3:45 PM
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
